definition: semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide
surname Fu
logographic stage

sentences.english: What is proper to the totality of signifiers.
sentences.chinese: 什么是意符的整体性的本体位置？

sentences.english: The function of desire is a last residuum of the effect of the signifier in the subject.
sentences.chinese: 欲望的功用是意符影响主体的最后残渣。

sentences.english: This is perhaps what it really is, the hole from which the master signifier arises.
sentences.chinese: 主人意符起源的这个空洞，可能就是它真实的样子。

definition: phonetic component of a Chinese character
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
phonetic/phonological/transliteration
phono-semantic compound character
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
to express meaning/ideographic
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
writing symbol
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
ideograph/ideographical writing system
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
phonetic component of Chinese character
symbol/mark/sign
